text: [music playing]

When I was a little
girl, I dreamed of being
an Olympic figure skater.

But by the age of 12, I
was already 6 feet tall

and could barely get
around one revolution,
let alone a triple axle.

And at the same time, I
was cast in my first play

in the pivotal role of the
undertaker's son in Oliver.
[laughing]

And after that, well, it
was an actor's life for me.

I'm Allison Janney,
and I'm an actor.
[cheering]

When I was a little girl, I
dreamt of growing up and being

a courageous woman
who could use my voice

for important issues
that affect all of us
and have a lot of shoes.

Well, I'm happy to report
that both are true.
[laughing]

I utilize my agency and my
voice for equity and justice
in our industry and beyond.
And I have so many shoes.
[laughing]
OK, like, I have a lot of shoes.

I am Tracee Ellis
Ross, and I'm an actor.
[cheering]

Just a few years ago, I
would sit at home in England

and perform impressions, from
Joan Rivers to Amy Winehouse.

I'm here now nominated at the
Screen Actors Guild Awards.

To all the young girls,
I believe in you,

believe in your dreams,
follow your hearts.

I'm Millie Bobby Brown,
and I am an actor.
[cheering]
